name: Colcord Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We travel with our 2 dogs and had previously stayed at the Sheraton in OKC, one block from the Colcord. We generally love Sheraton hotels for their very accomodating dog policy but the Sheraton in OKC was not our favorite--very noisy rooms. We had walked by the Colcord on our last stay and thought it looked like a very "cool" place.
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay in OKC

reviews.text: Our travels took us back to OKC this last weekend and we booked our stay, with dogs, at the Colcord.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with character

reviews.text: The staff was extrememly friendly and eager to please. We were upgraded to a suite. The room was wonderful. The bathroom was immense, the whirlpool tub was the perfect respite after our action packed days (we were attending a regatta).
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: This was a really great hotel for dog travelers. We were especially impressed that they have certain rooms designated for dogs and those rooms have HEPA fileters to keep the room ultra clean (although, of course, our dogs are perfectly clean and never shed a hair).
reviews.title: Hands down best hotel in OKC

reviews.text: The restaurant downstairs looked very nice. The room service menu (from the downstairs restaurant) was very reasonable. Our schedule did not allow time for a meal at the restaurant this time. But we would definitely try it next time...and there will be a next time.
reviews.title: Terrific Service in a Great Location

reviews.text: We stay regularly in downtown OKC, and we have tried all the hotels. The Colcord is, in our estimation, the best of them all (and several are excellent). The staff is always superb, and the rooms are spacious, clean, and well furnished. More ambiance than the nearby Courtyard and Hampton; bigger rooms than the Skirvin; better staff than the others. The Colcord is a winner!
reviews.title: Downtown's best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: And don't let the construction comments deter you. It's easy to get to, even with the street construction; just use Sheridan from I-235 straight to the door. The high-rise next door is past the extremely noisy stages of construction, but to be safe, ask for a room on the opposite side.
reviews.title: Construction and more construction

reviews.text: Unfortunately the Colcord is in the midst of construction of a mega-highrise next door. Getting to the front door is a chore, in fact the front door is closed due to the construction. I elected to park my own vehicle, a big mistake. Should have paid for the valet service.
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was excellent. Modern, clean, no problems whatsoever.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I presume that after the highrise is completed this will be a good stay for a downtown hotel. Located only a few blocks from the Brickyard shopping and restaurant district, we were soaking wet from the 100 degree temps after the short walk. Neither the heat nor the construction are the fault of the hotel. If you need a downtown hotel and don't like the mainline big names, this is the place. Just wait til the rebuilding of downtown OKC is completed.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!

reviews.text: I didn’t expect something so special in Oklahoma City. The building is historic but the rooms are comfortable and contemporary….very Boutique. From check-in to check-out the staff was efficient yet friendly. The fresh flowers in the hallways were a nice touch. Loved my mattress!!! Slept like a baby! Free coffee in the lobby and free WI-FI are features I really appreciate.
reviews.title: What a Fun Find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here and the service was great. The room was much nicer than we expected with a very large dressing area connected to the bathroom. Beds were great. It was easy to walk to the Ford Center from this hotel and with the way the streets are tore up driving would have been very difficult. Parking at the hotel was valet and very reasonable priced at only $10.00.
reviews.title: Hotel was fantastic with easy access to Ford Center.

reviews.text: Would definitely stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have stayed at the Colcord three Xmas,s in row.everything has gone very smoothy , service is excellent & I wouldn't.t hesitate to recommend it
reviews.title: What a way to celebrate!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was my husband's 50th and I suprised him by having five other couples stay at the Colcord with us to celebrate. This is one of the most accomodating hotels I have ever stayed at. Every person that we came in contact with that worked there, was totally engaged in their job as well as the comfort of the guests. Staying at the Colcord offered everything to us. They have an awesome restaurant in the hotel and a cocktail area. We also took advantage of the shuttle service the hotel offers. We went to various places which allowed us to go with our friends and relax without the hassle of traffic and parking. It is also in walking distance to Bricktown. The hotel is beautiful and it seems to run with complete ease and class. Did I mention the beds? Every single person that was with us commented on how comfortable they were. We are definately going back soon. It was awesome!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.text: Okay service. But disappointed after that. We checked in to find room service trays in the hall ( that stayed there over night and into the next day ). Our bathroom had what appeared to be blood spatter on the wall, as well as other filth. The shower was dirty. When we left the next morning we turned the light on for housekeeping only to return hours later to an untouched room. We then turned the "do not disturb" light on so that our 2 year old could get her noon time nap, and 20 minutes later housekeeping knocked on our door! We finally decided to talk with someone about all of this and they DID move us to another room and take 1 night off of our bill, which we appreciated. But the second we rounded to corner going to the new room, we were greeted by TRAYS in the hall, that stayed there all afternoon. And a room that had walls just as dirty as the first room. Got charged for parking even though there was construction going on next door that prevented anyone from parking and you HAD to valet your vehicle! No spa and I didn't see a pool. The restaurant was good but, they said its closing for a remodel and won't be open for 1 year!
reviews.title: Will Try Elsewhere next time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby and rooms are exquisite. We were only in town one night, to go to a Redhawks game, and decided to try this hotel rather than stay again at the Residence Inn across from the ballpark which (judging from recent reviews) is not as good as when it first opened. The Colcoard let us check in a wee bit early because a room was ready when we arrived - we actually had two rooms and had brought along a family member. We enjoyed a nice dinner in the hotel restaurant. The waitress recommended the pork and it was excellent, as was our appetizer. Cocktails were well done and very reasonable. We came back to the bar after the ballgame and enjoyed it immensely. The staff were very personable. It wasn't busy so they had time to chat a bit. It is clearly a great hotel for business travelers. The bed was very comfy too. The only annoyance which, sadly, really detracted from the Colcord's image was the failure to pick up room service trays that littered the hallway on our floor - and I don't mean just one or two trays!. Trays were by the elevator and practically outside every room on the floor - when we checked in around 2:30pm (the maids were still cleaning) , again at midnight and still there the next morning. It was a real shame, because it was just a bit too much and totally unexpected at a hotel that is tasteful, classy and understated in every other respect.
reviews.title: Really Loved This Hotel & Location is Perfect

reviews.text: I've stayed here several times. The rooms are perfect. Spacious. They have everything you need. Beds are comfortable. Rooms are clean. Somebody put a lot of time into picking out some great amenities and the design is lovely. Customer service could be a bit better. The restaurant was... So-so.
reviews.title: One of my favorite hotels of all time!

reviews.text: The Colcord is an all-around great hotel in downtown OKC. It's right across from the convention center and botanical gardens, and 3-4 blocks to Bricktown. It has great historical architectural touches in the lobby, but the rooms are modern, comfortable, quiet, and very big. It's not cheap, however.
reviews.title: Fantastic place

reviews.text: Only minor inconvenience at the present time (June 2011) is that it's right next to the Devon Tower skyscraper that is under construction, so the road right outside the Colcord is filled with construction traffic. However, I did not hear any construction noise at all from my room, so this shouldn't dissuade you. (My room was on the 8th floor and faced the street away from the construction.)
reviews.title: Highly Recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just spent a weekend at the Colcord. (We were picking up our daughter from a camp at OCU, which is approximately 10 minutes away.) After reading all of the rave reviews, I must say I was...disappointed. The hotel itself is fine. Front desk was excellent, and the complimentary breakfast was also excellent. Free wifi. However, there is a massive construction project going on across the street, which affected access to the hotel (i.e., streets were blocked. It would have been nice to get an email from the hotel about this), you must use the valet, the bar is closed, and the construction started at 6:30 on a Saturday morning. I was looking forward to my first opportunity to sleep in in ages, and was woken up to the sound of a sledgehammer. SO... We did go to Bricktown, which is very hopping at night, and we had some excellent BBQ at Earl's which is fairly close by. Also went to the Cowboy museum, which is approximately 15 minutes away, and very well done.
reviews.title: Construction really affected quality of stay

reviews.text: This hotel is fantastic. From the minute I pulled up to the valet to the second I drove away, it was absolutely wonderful. The staff at this hotel is all about service and making it a pleasant stay. The rooms are beautifully appointed, wonderful bed, chaise lounge. Room service is excellent and fast. Fresh gerber daisies were on each floor by the elevators and in vases on the walls. I wish I could have stayed longer and I will defiintely be back!
reviews.title: LOVED, LOVED, LOVED IT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oklahoma City was our first waypoint on a massive road trip through the Southwest. We did not consider it a "destination"...just a place to hang our hats for the night on our way to somewhere interesting. I found the Colcord based on other reviews here on T.A. We were not just pleasantly surprised, we were shocked at the quality of the accomodations. The room was beyond comfortable and beautifully appointed with quality linens, etc. Service was expedient and unobtrusive. Most of all, due I think in particular to the room being equipped with a free standing hepa air purifier that provided clean air AND white noise, it was quiet and condusive to an excellent night's sleep. We will definitely book the Colcord again the next time we're passing through Oklahoma.
reviews.title: Shockingly Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for our honeymoon and the hotel is absolutely beautiful. Service was friendly and the room was immaculate -- we stayed in a corner King. The only reason why I took away a star was because the parking situation is pretty ugly due to construction in the area. You have to park across the street in the garage behind the Sheraton on the 4th floor. This wouldn't be so bad but you have to either go through a sketchy corridor between the Sheraton or go through the Sheraton itself so it's not a short distance, especially if you are not using Valet and are dragging luggage. Other than that we will definitely stay here again when we visit OKC.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed at the Colcord for 2 nights. The room was nicely updated but the bathroom lights did not work well and were never fixed during our stay. We were assigned to a room right next to the elevator so noise was a problem. Our view was of the office building right across the alley. Felt we were given the worst room in the hotel since we had booked on expedia.
reviews.title: Nice hotel with problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I had a wonderful stay at the Colcord. We enjoy historic hotels with a modern feel and the Colcord was just that.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Our room was enormous. I couldn't believe how large it was. Everything in our room was modern and exceeded expectations.
reviews.title: Outstanding!!

description: Opened in 1910, this majestic 12-story office building was Oklahoma City’s first skyscraper. The hotel is excitingly different, radiating with a modernized, Art Deco feel in the lobby, and hip, oversized guest rooms. Sheathed in terra-cotta and accented by ornamentation typical of the early 20th century, it is on the National Register of Historic Places.
